meanings.definition: The state of being a vassal.
meanings.sent1: In the kingdom, his vassalage to the king was evident.
meanings.sent2: The vassalage system was common in medieval times.
meanings.sent3: The vassalage of the knight to the queen led to many adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her vassalage to the powerful sorcerer was like being bound by invisible chains.
meanings.sent5: The concept of vassalage can be compared to a loyal dog following its master.

meanings.definition: The obligations of a vassal to a lord.
meanings.sent1: He fulfilled his vassalage by paying tribute to his lord.
meanings.sent2: The vassalage included military service and loyalty.
meanings.sent3: The vassalage of bringing the lord his favorite dessert was gladly accepted.
meanings.sent4: The vassalage felt like a heavy burden on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The vassalage was a solemn promise to serve and obey.

meanings.definition: The relationship between a vassal and a lord.
meanings.sent1: Their vassalage was built on trust and mutual respect.
meanings.sent2: The vassalage was based on a feudal contract.
meanings.sent3: The vassalage between them was like a dance of power and submission.
meanings.sent4: The vassalage symbolized the bond between the two individuals.
meanings.sent5: The vassalage was a complex web of duties and privileges.
